workflow.name: Voice & text Telegram assistant with GPT-4.1-mini and conversation memory
workflow.description:
# Personal AI Assistant on Telegram

**Who It‚Äôs For:**

- This workflow is designed for developers, founders, community managers, and automation enthusiasts who want to bring a personal AI assistant directly into their Telegram chat.
- It lets users interact naturally‚Äîeither through text or voice messages‚Äîand get instant, AI-powered replies without switching apps or opening dashboards.

‚ö° What It Does / How It Works

üì• Message Trigger: A Telegram Trigger node listens for incoming messages.
üß≠ Smart Routing: A Switch node decides if the user sent a text or voice message.
üó£Ô∏è Voice to Text: If it‚Äôs voice, the workflow uses OpenAI Whisper Transcription to convert it into text.
üß† AI Processing: The text is passed to an AI Agent powered by GPT-4.1-mini to understand intent and craft a response.
üí¨ Reply: The bot sends a clean, structured, and polite answer back to the user on Telegram.
üß† Memory: A buffer memory node keeps short-term conversation history for a more contextual, human-like experience.

üß∞ **How to Set It Up:**
1. Telegram Integration

- Create a bot via @BotFather on Telegram.
- https://telegram.me/BotFather
- Add your Telegram API Key to n8n credentials.
- Connect the Telegram Trigger and Send a Message nodes.

2. OpenAI Setup

- Get your API key from platform.openai.com.
- https://platform.openai.com/api-keys
- Configure the OpenAI Chat Model and Transcribe a Recording nodes with GPT-4.1-mini.

3. Workflow Logic

- Use the Switch node to detect message type (text or voice).
- Route voice messages through transcription before sending them to the AI agent.
- Add Simple Memory to maintain short conversational context.

4. Go Live

- Activate the workflow.
- Send a message or voice note to your bot.
- Get instant replies from your personal AI assistant. üöÄ

üõ°Ô∏è **Requirements:**

- n8n (self-hosted or cloud)
- Telegram Bot API key
- OpenAI API key (for GPT-4.1-mini)
- Basic understanding of n8n nodes and connections

üåü **Why Use This Workflow:**

‚úÖ Hands-free experience: Just talk or type.
üß† AI-powered responses: Natural language understanding with GPT.
‚ö° Real-time interaction: Fast replies via Telegram.
üîÅ Memory-aware conversations: Feels more human.
üß© Modular design: Easily extend to other AI tools or platforms.

options.systemMessage:
=You are a personal assistant that helps user fulfill their requests.

When you are asked to perform a task on the current date, please use the current time and date :  {{ $now }}

## OUtput

You should output the result and don't include any thing unnecessary. Just  make sure that you politely answer user question and ask if any other information is required.

parameters.content: üí° It activates this workflow and triggers/initiates the Telegram message!
üí° It split the input from the user. If the user input is text. Then it goes directly to the test field. Else it will be converted into Text Format.
üí° This node helps your agent to fetch the voice note file
üí° Transcriber helps to convert the voice into words/text format to analyze the word from the user.
üí° These nodes get the input text message from Telegram. Then it throws to the AI Agent to give the response back with the help of the OpenAI Chat Model!

üí° Your AI agent can:
1. **Receive** messages from the Telegram chat
2. **Respond** with the OpenAI Chat Model and provide helpful answers.

üí° This is the **GPT 4.1 mini** chat model. Here we need to connect with our **API key** to utilize this AI model.

üí° And this is a simple memory to help your agent remember the last few messages to stay on topic.

üí° This will send back the response to the user in Telegram. 

üí° Here we need to connect with our **Telegram API key** to make a connection.

user.name: Balakrishnan C
user.bio:
AI-Driven DevOps Automation Engineer | AWS Certified
I build end-to-end automation systems using n8n, HF, AWS Lambda, Bedrock, and Chat-based AI agents.
Passionate about transforming manual infra management into intelligent self-service workflows.
